fields.description:
To reproduce create one or more subtasks.  Resolve all of them and click on the "Open" tab for the subtasks.  Now there is no way to switch back to viewing all subtasks, unless manually adding "?subTaskView=all" to the URL.

It would be nice to have the link to show all subtasks in cases when there is at least 1 closed subtask.
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks tabs disappear when selection open and all sub-tasks are closed

fields.description: The unvote link (Profile --> Your votes --> Unvote) does not seem to work.
fields.summary: Unvote link does not work

fields.description: The dropdown box for the subtasks renders corrupt in IE. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Rendering Bug in Sub-Tasks table

fields.description: Please enable HTML/ Rich Text in Description/ Comments. Or does this already exist in newer versions ?
fields.summary: HTML/ Rich Text in Description/ Comments

fields.description:
The issue security functionality is a great way to create issues that cannot be seen by all users.

The same functionality on custom fields would be extremely powerful. We often create issues than can be seen by both our company and our customers. Today we cannot enter information on the issues that is hidden from the customers. This feature is highly requested.

I suggest you consider implementing field security on each field (via the field scheme) like it is possible on an issue.
fields.summary: Request for new feature: Field Security
Workflow-Scheme select during project creation

fields.description: In my project, I have 48 open issues. When using the Preset Filter "Outstanding", the result displays all 48 issues. When I switch to "Full Content", I see only the first 30. However, there is no "Next", or "More" button or link that indicates that I don't have them all.
fields.summary: Full Content only displays first page of issues (no Next/Previous links)

fields.description:
I created a new workflow (copy of jira).
added a new status: need info
created a transition Open -> Need Info (inlcuding comment)
created a transition Need Info -> In Progress (incl. comment)
created a transition Need Info -> Need Info (including comment) 

I created a new issue. Then i transitioned to "Need Info". Entered a comment and it worked fine. Then i used my Transition to "Need Info" again, entered a comment and ... no comment was saved and the change log did not show any changes.
fields.summary: Self referencing Workflow-Step does not work

fields.description:
Get issues list (Find Issues), then switch to Full Content.
All dates in comments are the issue creation dates, but not comments creation dates.
But if you open single issue, all dates are correct.
fields.summary: Find Issues->Full Content. Wrong dates in comments.

fields.description: The name of the month "März" is not displayed correct. JIRA does not seem to handle international characters at this point.
fields.summary: Month name does not displayed correct
Per-user time reporting for timesheets

fields.description:
There is currently no interface to delete trackback links in JIRA (if, for example, the linked-to page no longer exists).  We need to add one.

For now, trackback pings can be removed by deleting the appropriate record in the 'trackback_ping' table.
fields.summary: Interface for deleting trackback links
Get rid of global permissions
Prevent users deleting the administrators/users group

fields.description: If an issue summary text has the greater-than character, you get weird results in the History popup window.
fields.summary: History popup window does not properly escape some text

fields.description: We have projects that are visible to external customers and internal staff. Most of the comments on an issue should only be visible to internal staff, not to customers, but the default visibility for a comment is "All Users". It's error prone to need to remember to change this to the group for all internal staff - it would be better to be able to specify a default group for comment visibility, either by project (with fallback to "All Users" if a given user is not in this group), or by user.
fields.summary: Specify default visibility for comments

fields.description: Currently you can hack the URL to display X issues by appending '?tempMax=X'.  This ought to be a property on the user object, configured on the navigator configuration page.
fields.summary: Set number of issues displayed in issue navigator

fields.description:
Trackbacks from Confluence to Jira don't work on our installation.

I added a link from a Confluence page to a Jira task. The link works. In Jira I checked that Trackbacks are on. When I view the Jira task I don't see any referrer page links.

Is it something to do with us using https for both Confluence and Jira?

This is a problem because trackbacks allow an easy integration between Conf and Jira: we can manage User Stories in Conf, tasks in Jira, and have bidirectional links between the two by referencing the Tasks from the User Story.
fields.summary: Trackbacks don't work from Confluence to Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*8NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5052].
{panel}


The new clone functionality is very useful. It would be really great if we could control what parts of an issue was cloned. For instance:
 * Clone entire issue (subtasks, comments, worklog, everything)
 * Clone with subtasks only
 * Clone with new reporter
 * Clone without subtasks
 * Clone linked issues
 * Etc.

Hopefully you get the idea.

fields.description:
The standard login page has a top link (Login or Sign up) which leads to http://jira.atlassian.com/Signup!default.jspa. At the bottom link there is a link (Not a member? Signup for an account.) which points to http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Signup!default.jspa.

The first link does not work on standalone version. All style information is missing.

In addition, the "Login" part is bold, the "Sign up" part is not. Both should be bold and underlined, just as the "Signup" link below.
fields.summary: Sign up link broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5045].
  {panel}

JIRA generates bad HTML in general. No quotes around parameters, for example.

The roadmap table, for example, could be made better if the initial columns would be set at 24px (width of the icons) and not at 5%. Also a lot of HTML can be spared if you just specify the column-width at the top with <COL> elements of define some CSS for it.

    <col width="25"> <-- first
    <col width="25"> <-- second
    <col width="60"> <-- BUG number
    etc.. 

Because, as it is, 3.0.x has some seriously mis-aligned layouts compared to 2.x
fields.summary: Bad HTML

fields.description: The layout of the roadmap is ... weird. Issue summaries are centered, which they shouldn't be. Same goes for version names. See screenshot.

fields.description:
I attached a screenshot of the roadmap: the cell spanning is very unfortunate. The Title should not just span the first three columns. This introduces a lot of wasted white space. 

My proposal is as follwos:

Table has 7 columns:
Title row: tile spans 4 columns, Progressbar spans 3 columns
Normal row: one col for Icon, ID, Resolution, Descr spans 2 columns, 1 col for Level and State

In other words the forth column is for enabling the overlapping of long titles with the descriptions.
fields.summary: Roadmap Layout

I cannot search for a specific assignee nor reporter (didn't try the other user fields) Here is what happens: 
I select "specify user" (i'd expect the user icon to become active as in 2.6.1 but it doesn't) filling in the form with the name of a user is allowed and seems to find the right issues, but it is a pitty that the user/group selector stays disabled.

fields.summary: Date Picker display problem

fields.description:
When specifying a portlet in the atlassian-plugin.xml - it is necessary to specify an i18n string and provide a properties file with the associated key value pair.

If the name is specified in the atlassian-plugin.xml, the portlet will not display the correct name and the console logs a number of errors that the name cannot be retrieved.

It should be possible to simply specify the name in the atlassian-plugin.xml file without having to cater for i18n.
fields.summary: Porlets - cannot specify Portlet name without i18n string and associated property.

fields.description:
To reproduce this issue:

1. Create a new user (testuser). Associate the user with the 'jira-administrators' and 'jira-users' groups.
2. Create a new project (testproject). Select the 'testuser' as a 'Lead Developer'. 
(Note - JIRA warns that the lead developer is not assignable at this point)
3. Associate the 'Default Permission Scheme' with this project. 
4. Login as 'testuser'.
5. Create anew issue in 'testproject', fill all required fields and press "Create". 


No error message is displayed - but issue creation has failed due to the fact that the default assignee does not have assignable permission.
fields.summary: Issue Creation fails without displaying an error if user cannot assign issue.

fields.description:
On viewing the text format release notes for XDoclet 1.2.2 in our JIRA http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?version=10120&styleName=Text&projectId=10000&Create=Create I noticed that the HTML version at the top of the page had some bits missing from the issue titles. For example, issue XDT-726 "[XDT-726] - subtask does not generate resource-refs with URLs" was displayed as "[XDT-726] - subtask does not generate resource-refs with URLs". The corresponding HTML source reads
  • [XDT-726] - subtask does not generate resource-refs with URLs
    • so the browser thinks the is an unknown HTML element and hides it. It needs to be escaped as <jbosswebxml>
fields.summary: Upgrade XDoclet JIRA to latest release

fields.description:
I'm trying to set up a CVS connection in 3.0.2. We use SSH (:ext:) with our repository. 

I have given the 'jira' user appropriate keys. I can ssh to the CVS server. I can check out the repository on the command line, eg.:
	login jira
	cvs -d ":ext:jira@tonatiuh:/home/cvsroot" checkout Harmony
And it works just fine. The repository checks out flawlessly.

Trying to use JIRA's admin console to configure CVS I have made the following settings:
Name: Harmony
CVS Root: :ext:jira@tonatiuh:/home/cvsroot
Module name: Harmony
Log retrieval: Automatic
Log file path: /usr/local/jira/temp/cvs-module1.log

This results in the error "Error authenticating with the repository. Could not open ssh connection. Please see underlying message."

There are no status messages on the CVS server. It doesn't look like a connection attempt was ever made. This seems quite an important detail. Normally, the server should emit some kind of log message if a connection attempt was initiated.

As an alternative to making this work, is it possible to have a cron job gather information from CVS and make it available to JIRA? This is a major problem for us. We've been trying to get CVS integration to work ever since 2.6.0 was shipped. I'm sorely disappointed that we are still having so much trouble.

If I look in the logs, this is what I see:

fields.description:
I've written a listener basing it off a 'standard' issue event listener from Atlassian. I've attached it (after filing the bug).

The listener calls a web listener running on somewhere else. There is no problem calling the external web listener. 

The problem is that the event parameter routine 'getComment()' will return a null value if a comment is the only modification done to the issue.

I fully realize that my users could go and select 'add comment' under 'operations' while browsing the issue. However, my users are stupid and will more than likely select 'edit issue' and only add a comment.

Note: If a single field is modified in addition to adding an issue comment then the event.getComment() returns the new comment.

I've written my listener to log messages for every event call - the only event which is called after the issue is modified is 'issueUpdated'. issueCommented is not called unless the user selects 'add comment' under operations.

I can work around this by modifying the jsp file for edit issue and removing the lines which display the comment box. However, I would like to avoid this if possible.

-wc
fields.summary: CLONE - No Notification when comment is added via edit operation and no fields modified

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5012].
  {panel}

Raised for Kyle Lucas (JSP-265):

"It is kind of ugly to have to do a filter every time I want to look for
a value in custom field. So for example if I want to find my custom
field called companyname(my custom field). I have to create a filter
for companyname equal to the value I want and run it- every time. Is
there a way to just type in the custom field somewhere and have it
happen? Like in quick search. Or even better yet. A way to specifiy
that I want a filter and it asks me for the data that it does not know.


Even better is that I can have dynamic data like. If the date is today
- 14 and the status = OPEN and the "custom field=X:prompt" the user
types in the value and gets it.

Kyle "

Essentially I think what's wanted here is an Access/Rational ClearQuest styled saved search that prompts for values of certain specified fields when you run them
fields.summary: Prompt user for search criteria at filter activation time

fields.description:
I create the following casacading select:

List 1
  option1.1
  option1.2
  option1.3
List 2
  option2.1
  option2.2
  option2.3
List 3
  option3.1
  option3.2
  option3.3

When I create an issue everything is fine.  I then make this a required field I then see the following at issue creation:

List 1
  none
List 2
  none
  option1.1
  option1.2
  option1.3
List 3
  none
  option2.1
  option2.2
  option2.3

I can switch back and forth between making the field required and optional.  Whenever it is optional everything is fine.  Whenever it is required I get the above.
fields.summary: "None" is still selectable in a cascading select custom field despite being set to required

fields.description: I've just downloaded the latest translation properties ZIP file. It doesn't contain anything other than the README.TXT file. Looks like there is a problem with your file generation procedure.
fields.summary: Translation Properties ZIP is empty

fields.description: Currently, if I wish to create a filter it must be for either one specific project or for all projects.  I would very much like the ability to create and save filters for greater than one project, but less than all.  A list of projects in a multi-select would work just fine.  In the case where there is other search criteria that is dependent upon the project (like components and versions), just don't allow the search to include those criteria if more than one project is selected.
fields.summary: Ability to create filters for multiple named projects, not just one or all

fields.description:
We have a problem with our mailserver. When attempting to look at the mail queue:
System -> Mail Queue -> Error Queue, the "tab" does not switch to the "Error Queue", thus preventing me from viewing the 19 e-mails which are in error.
fields.summary: Messages in Error Queue not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5006].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

Users may choose to watch individual issues. Some users however would like to receive notifications whenever anything is added or modified within a specific project. In order to set this up, currently, a new group and notification scheme needs to be created for each project, and users must be added by an administrator. Instead, there should be a watch/stop watching option available on every project summary page.
fields.summary: Allow users to watch a project

fields.description: Or maybe the fields which QuickSearch should consider should  become configurable.
fields.summary: Quick Search should look into Descripiton AND Comment

fields.description:
In JIRA's text notification emails, the "Remaining Estimate" and "Time Spent" field updates are reported in seconds, rather than something more useful (hours, minutes):

----------------------------------------

           Time Worked: 4 hours
    Remaining Estimate: 252000 (was: 266400)
            Time Spent: 36000 (was: 21600)

-----------------------------
fields.summary: Time updates in notifications are in seconds

fields.description: A user has contributed a fieldtype definition file for Frontbase, which works with only minor tweaking of entitymodel.xml.  We should add this to the next release of JIRA.
fields.summary: Add Frontbase database entity files

fields.description:
The problem is that JIRA 3.0 tries to add the name of a user that did the change to cause the notification to the "from" address. JIRA does this by simply surrounding the the from address with "<" and ">" and prepending the username. If the from address already has the username then the result is "username" <xxxx <address>> which is not valid.

Need to check the format of the from address and if it has a username part do not blindly surround it with "<" and ">" but maybe just prepend "username -", so the result wound be "username - xxxx" <address>.
fields.summary: If a from address for mail server is a "full" e-mail format (username <address>) notifications will fail

fields.description: For workflow steps like "Request Feedback" or "Confirm Fix" that request the reporter's feedback, the issue should be assigned back to the reporter.  We need an "Assign to reporter" workflow post-function to do this.
fields.summary: 'Assign to reporter' workflow function

fields.description: A useful portlet to write would be one that is configured with an XML feed URL, and an XSLT to apply to the XML.  You could then display syndicated content like RSS feeds (project news) on the dashboard.
fields.summary: RSS / XSLT portlet
Speed up workflow application

fields.description:
When viewing this webpage, even if it is added to the privacy settings and told to Always Allow cookies it does not allow some. Here is a list of some that I have noticed in the past.

http://issues.point2.com/images/spacer.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/icons/bug.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/status_open.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/priority_major.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/bluepixel.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/icons/bullet_creme.gif 
http://issues.point2.com/images/border/border_bottom.gif

My question is: Could there be any negative effects from the blocking of these cookies?
fields.summary: Cookies are blocked

fields.description: In the list of permissions 'delete issues' raises some problems: we dont want users to be able to delete an issue, only admins and say project lead, but we want all users to be able to modify or even delete their own comments. This is not possible right now because of the same permission managing 'delete issue' and 'delete comment'. One way out would be to have customizable permissions, but I did not see this feature in the JIRA version we have.
fields.summary: Side effect of 'delete issues' permission scheme entry

fields.description:
Currently the "Attach screenshot" link is only enabled for Windows users - however the OS X Java implementation (1.4.2_05 at any rate) does support the clipboard, and the applet does work in Safari.

The HTML for the attachments page is a bit broken though, with the comment textarea being unusably small.  See attachment.
fields.summary: Fix up and enable the screenshot applet on Mac OS X
CSV import doesn't import statuses correctly.

fields.description:
Ensure that all methods retrieving versions actually Version objects.

Such classes as ViewIssue.java return GenericValues rather than Version objects.

Should be consistent and always return Version objects.
fields.summary: Ensure version objects are returned throughout JIRA.
Different default assignee per issue type

fields.description:
In our JIRA 2.6.1 installation we have a custom field called "Maturity" of type "select list".

The list is entered (and ordered) as follows:

New (default)        
Requires Analysis    
Analysis Complete    
Requires Use Case    
Use Case Complete    
Requires Design    
Design Complete    
Requires Coding   
Coding Complete    
Requires QA   
QA Complete    
Requires Documentation    
Documentation Complete   
Finalised  

When performing a search, and this column header is clicked to sort, sort order is related to the order as shown above. (not alphanumberic on the label).

I have set up a Jira 3.0.1 installation and imported the same data.  When sorting by this column, the ordering is ignored, and the sort is done alphanumerically.

The 2.6.1 behaviour was much more useful to us.  Was there a good reason for this change, or did it just slip in?  (you wouldn't sort priority by alphanumeric on it's label!)

thanks,
fields.summary: sort order on custom field type "Select List" discrepancy 2.6.1 -> 3.0.1

fields.description: The find issues page is quite slow to come up in systems with a large number (around 50 or more) and /or issue types.
fields.summary: Find Issues page is slow to come up

fields.description:
If I have a script:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">

<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TP" summary="Issue summary" issueKeyVar="issuekey">
${issuekey},c:\oldsystem\attachments\foo.doc
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>

I would expect it to print the key of the issue, and the string.  Instead, the output is:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib'>,c:\oldsystem\attachments\foo.doc</JiraJelly>
fields.summary: Jelly CreateIssue issueIdVar and issueKeyVar attributes do not work

From a jira-user post:


I also have 3.0 running successfully, but I am getting the same "Check
SearchRequest for Relation 'ParentProject'" issue.

I created a filter which filters on a custom field.  When have the Integrity
Checker cleanup the issues above I notice my filters (only the ones
filtering on custom fields) get removed.  Also noticed when I create
statistics portlet based on the filter using the custom field, the
statistics show up fine, but if I click one of the links in the statistics
portlet I get an odd error message (don't have it handy right now).
Statistic portlets based on standard JIRA fields work fine.
fields.summary: Integrity check erroneously deletes cross-project filters

fields.description:
When an issue comment contains a CDATA section, this section's closing tag is not escaped correctly when exporting to XML. This causes a subsequent XML import to fail.

Proposed fix: Insert a closing and an opening CDATA tag right in the middle of the comment's CDATA closing tag. This causes the closing tag to break up and not mess up JIRA's escaping.

{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4980
A workaround for this issue has been written up in a KB article and is available here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Removing+invalid+characters+from+XML+backups

*Please note* JIRA 3.1 and above should not suffer from this problem. Invalid characters are automatically stripped from imported data, if you are noticing this error please contact http://support.atlassian.com with your .xml export file.

{panel}
fields.summary: CDATA sections in comments not escaped correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4976].
  {panel}

The filter related portlets (Filter Statistics & Two Dimensional Filter Statistics) should be removed gracefully if the associated filter has been removed.

At present, the 'Edit Portlet' and 'Delete Portlet' links are still available if the filter has been removed. These should be removed (at the very least - the edit link should be removed).

If the user is not logged in - and the delete link is selected - this results in system error.

The portlet should be removed if the associated filter is removed - as seems to be done for the "Show Saved Filter" portlet.
fields.summary: Filter related portlets should handle removed filters gracefully

fields.description:
Restoring backup should have an option to disable Jira from sending and fetching email right after the backup has been restored.

The current Jira behavior is to fetch email from the configured boxes right after the restoration even if the DB restore failed! This obviously causes the system to actively destroy data since the emails are lost into the DB that was failed to be restored properly.

Workaround is to restore while the server is disconnected from the network but given that probably most administration of Jira instances is handled remotely, this is not very optimal.

Deleting / not restoring email settings is not an option either since the settings might be quite complex. I guess you'd need a global "turn off email" switch and make all email functionality honor that.
fields.summary: Disable email functionality as part of backup restoration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4974].
  {panel}

The backup XML file contains a lot of paths to files, including the attachments, old cache, backup locations etc. The administrator can't view these without importing the file and if for example the attachments directory isn't where Jira expects it, the system is in inconsistent state when it's up after the restoration.

Optimally the backup process would work like this:

1) Tell Jira where the backup file is located
2) Jira scans the XML file and locates all the paths within the file
3) Administrator is presented with a page which lists those paths and allows editing them
4) Jira then restores the DB and replaces the paths stored in the XML with the paths the administrator provided
fields.summary: Graceful backup restoration is very hard if server path structure doesn't reflect backup XML
